arguments.text: A double‑blind, placebo‑controlled RCT evaluating remdesivir in hospitalized patients with Covid‑19 (n=1062). Primary endpoint: time to recovery. Results: median recovery 10 days (remdesivir) vs 15 days (placebo). Mortality 7.1% vs 11.9%...

Phase 3 double‑blind, placebo‑controlled RCT enrolling non‑hospitalized adults with mild‑moderate Covid‑19 (n=1433). Primary endpoint: hospitalization or death by day 29. Results: 6.8% (molnupiravir) vs 9.7% (placebo) met endpoint; relative risk reduction 30%...

messages.content:
- **Methods:** Double‑blind, placebo‑controlled randomized trial; 1062 hospitalized COVID‑19 patients; intervention: remdesivir 200 mg IV on day 1 then 100 mg daily for up to 9 days; control: matched placebo; primary outcome: time to clinical recovery.
- **Results:** Median time to recovery was 10 days with remdesivir versus 15 days with placebo. Overall mortality was 7.1% vs 11.9% (remdesivir vs placebo). Faster improvement in oxygen‑support status observed.

- **Methods:** Double‑blind, placebo‑controlled phase 3 trial; 1433 non‑hospitalized adults with mild‑moderate COVID‑19; intervention: molnupiravir 800 mg orally twice daily for 5 days; control: placebo; primary outcome: COVID‑19‑related hospitalization or death by day 29.
- **Results:** 6.8% of participants receiving molnupiravir reached the primary outcome versus 9.7% on placebo (RRR ≈ 30%). No deaths in the molnupiravir arm; 3 deaths in placebo. Faster viral clearance noted.
